Title: Vendor Master Data Analyst
Description: The Vendor Master Data Analyst is part of a global team who establishes and follows procedures that maintain the integrity of data for Master Data in SAP. These procedures allow business objectives to be met and to be compliant to (regional) Government regulations and Hexion regulations. The Master Data Analyst role is the key for setting up a good foundation for further execution of the business processes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
About us:
Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.
Behind one of the world’s best loved brands is a uniquely capable and brilliant team of data scientists, engineers and analysts. The Target Data Science & Analytics team creates the tools and data products to sustainably educate and enable our business partners to make great data-based decisions. We help develop the technology that personalizes the guest experience, from product recommendations to relevant ad content. We’re also the source of the data and analytics behind Target’s Internet of Things (IOT) applications, fraud detection, Supply Chain optimization and demand forecasting. We play a key role in identifying the test-and-measure or A/B test opportunities that continuously help Target improve the guest experience, whether they love to shop in stores or at Target.com.
A role with Data Science and Analytics (DSA) means being a part of the team that works closely with the business and identifies problems / opportunities for improved decision-making through better data analysis. This covers the whole gamut from simple descriptive analysis to more complex predictive and prescriptive analytics, using advanced modeling and machine learning techniques primarily using open source technologies and big data platforms. The emphasis is on actionable insights, which is possible through a combination of technical skills and business understanding.
As Data Analyst, DSA you will work closely with business/product teams and understand their priorities/roadmap. Based on this understanding, you are expected to identify appropriate metrics that will drive the right decisions for the business, and then build reporting solutions to deliver these metrics at the required frequency in an optimal and reliable fashion. You will also answer ad-hoc questions from your business users by conducting quick analysis on relevant data, identify trends and correlations, and form hypotheses to explain the observations. Some of these will lead to bigger analytical projects of increasing complexity, where you will work initially as a part of a bigger team, but also work independently as you gain more experience. Finally, you are expected to always adhere to project schedule and technical rigor as well as requirements for documentation, code versioning, etc.
Core responsibilities are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.
About You:
B.Tech / B.E. or equivalent experience
1+ years of relevant experience
“Hands-on” experience in analytics / data science
Understanding of foundational mathematics and statistics
Conceptual understanding of analytical techniques like Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Time-series models, Classification Techniques, etc.
Basic SQL skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills to explain complex analytical methodologies to clients regardless of the clients technical expertise
Exposure to R, Python, Hive, or other open source languages preferable
Big data experience preferable

Qualifications:

Title: Data and Analytics
Description:
Role Designation- Lead Analyst - Data Science

Responsibilities- 1. Document simple as-is customer processes 2. Appreciate the context of customer requirements from specific engagements 3. Align our deliverables to customer requirements 4. Responsible for successful delivery of Advanced Analytics solutions and services in client consulting environment; experience in optimization (linear, mixed integer, constraint programming), simulation, and/or predictive analytics using AAO tools, such as SAS or SPSS. 5. Define key business problems to be solved; formulate mathematical approaches and gather data to solve those problems, develop, analyze/draw conclusions and present to client. 6. Assist clients in identifying type of analytics and management data that will directly relate to improving clients' market share or any other measure client is addressing. 7. Identify the differentiators, map them to present-day environment, and then design an improvement plan. 8. Discover new opportunities to optimize the business through analytics and statistical modeling. 9. Oversee all aspects of analytics and business intelligence projects. 10. Develop and maintain reporting and analytical tools, including Business Objects.

Technical and Professional Requirements- Education and experience: • Prefer PhD or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Commerce, Science • Domain experience in Retail/Finance/Supply Chain or/and Marketing will be an added bonus • Exposure to US/ overseas markets is preferred Domain / Technical /Tools Knowledge: • Proficiency with statistical analysis tools (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R) • Hands on experience in Statistical Techniques such as Decision Tree, Segmentation, Logistic and Multiple Regression, and others • Experience of Campaign Management and Customer Segmentation is desirable • Strong Excel, Access and PowerPoint skills • Familiarity with database query tools (SQL) • Basic understanding of data warehouse architecture

Educational Requirements: MSc , BE , BSc
Service Line: Unit-IPS-Data & Analytics Unit

Title: Analyst Quality Programs
Description:
Description:
PRIMARY FUNCTION
Ensures a high level of quality service for guests and business partners by owning the assigned quality processes and projects related to Quality Support applications. Create and maintain new capabilities, assist TI quality team and other partners in obtaining data relevant to applicable strategies, and work to ensure stable, reliable, consistent tools and data sources.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for the planning & execution of projects/workload by building, tuning, maintaining all interaction analytics categories within applicable tools.
Handle reporting, calibrations, data collection & other interactions with Target India & MPLS partners.
Own & Lead efforts to analyze data and provide recommendations to support TI Managers and Quality Support Specialists by listening to calls, analyzing transactions & other non-call data. By compiling information and reporting from quality tools, support the execution of targeted quality projects, contact center agent performance, contact center guest experience (Net promoter score), compliance discrepancies etc.…
Act as a subject matter expert for the related work stream, lead projects and other initiatives assigned as a POC, adhering to all POC responsibilities. Support other work streams as required.
Collaborates effectively within the Quality team (TI & MPLS) to clearly define objectives, requirements, timelines, analysis requirement and success measures of projects/initiatives of related work-stream.
Measure performance (Accuracy, Timelines, POC responsibilities etc.) through tracking feedback from auditors and partners as a POC on all assigned projects and call out challenges on a timely manner to ensure smooth experience for Partners and Auditors.
Train & share knowledge as required – create training plans, training documents, share feedback on trainee progress & manage their performance through the ramp period.
Interact with TI POC’s, QSS and TI Managers to identify, define and measure the impact of work/data capture completed by the auditors.
Maintain track record of performance, impact and feedback received for POC’s/responsible Level3’s on all projects/initiatives and call out trends to TI Managers.
Own, publish and present end to end of critical reviews & reports, dashboards of processes as applicable to the relevant stakeholders. Create & maintain documentation on the processes supported to iron out any discrepancies & have clear guidelines for future support.
Perform additional responsibilities as assigned
Work towards the Team deliverables in Target India. Contribute to the overall productivity and accuracy as per standards defined in the team
Drive the different initiatives in Target India with enthusiasm and in a fast, fun and friendly way.
Support project and department leaders to identify, analyze and evaluate business/Team issues.
Make recommendations for process improvement and participates in implementation of new initiatives.
Flexibility to work outside normal business hours as required
REPORTING/WORKING RELATIONSHIPS
Reports to: TI Sr. Manager
Working relationships with Quality Business Consultants and FRS business areas as need, including Business Systems, Global Operations, and contact center leader
JOB REQUIREMENTS
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
3 years of relevant experience in contact center (listening to calls, managing reports etc.)
3 years Bachelor’s Degree
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Strong problem solving, critical thinking and decision making skills,
Data Mining, Ability to identify data trends
Strong Team player
Root cause Analysis and concepts of yellow belt, Lean
Project management skills & Presentation skills
Reporting and analytical skills
High MS office & VBA knowledge on Excel
DESIRED REQUIREMENTS
Speech analytics capabilities

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Data Management practice is set up under Business Intelligence/BI Function with scope covering various Maersk group companies. This organization is responsible for Data Management & Data Governance of all Data in Maersk group including Master data, Reference data and even Transactional data. We also support internal projects with offerings like Data Governance set up, Access Management, Data Quality Review, Data Profiling, Data Reporting, Data Migration & Data Mapping.
We offer
As an employee with Maersk GSC you will be part of a working environment as diverse as the APMM group. Maersk strongly encourages continuous learning at work and sharing of best practices by rewarding innovations. We aren’t all about work, we believe in a holistic development of our employees and so regularly organize recreational activities giving our employees a chance to unwind and showcase their creative side. As an organization we strongly believe in a people-centric approach with emphasis on employee engagement and work-life balance.
Key responsibilities
The Data Quality Analyst will be responsible for the following tasks, amongst others:

Staging data into DQ repository form multiple source systems for data quality analysis.

Examining the data and collecting statistics or informative summaries about that data.

Running data profiling on the source data and identifying and reporting anomalies based on pre-defined business rules / standards

Assess data quality, including whether the data conforms to standards or patterns.

Assess the risk involved in integrating data in new applications, including the challenges of joins

Raising data quality level for different data objects.

Providing a high level of data quality awareness among users to get the clean-up done.

Helps the Scrum Master & Product Owner in the ongoing management of the backlog, working ahead of the team to ensure that future product requirements are well defined

Evaluating and identifying where system enhancements are required.

Sharing data quality reports with business users at regular intervals.

Coordinate with business users for performing manual cleansing as required

Supports Business Data Stewards to develop and refine Business Metadata.

Lookout for changes to data-related legislation for external business implications as well as internal communications and compliance

We are looking for
Should have high energy level, and thrive in a fast-paced environment with ambitions to deliver outstanding results. We require fluency in oral and written English, and proven experience with the
following:

5-6 years of experience working as a Data Analyst in a global organisation with understanding of SQL query writing and exposure to Informatica ETL tool.

Good understanding of data quality life cycle and data quality dimensions.

Excellent Data Profiling and Data Quality skills.

Collaboration and teamwork, and an ability to look beyond functional needs to the bigger picture

Grasping complex issues and driving effective problem solving

Proven passion for the data quality discipline

Good interpersonal skills

Outstanding attention to detail

Talent for quickly learning new tasks

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

A strong drive for results

Ability to function in a high-volume setting with tight deadlines

Demonstrates ability to think both strategically and tactically.

Experience with the principles and concepts used in Master Data Management.

Title: Data Lineage Analyst
Description:
Your role
Are you detail oriented, with experience in running operational processes and controls, as well ensuring that complex concepts are simply and correctly documented?
Are you able to communicate confidently and concisely across all levels of seniority and functional and divisional boundaries?
Are you a quick learner who enjoys working as part of a team that has global presence?
Do you spot opportunities to improve processes and then implement these efficiencies to realize benefits?

We’re looking for a Data Lineage Analyst to:
Partner with Business Divisions, Functions, IT and other teams in the DMO to ensure the creation and maintenance of all artefacts (systems, data elements, controls, ownership) captured in the Group Data Dictionary in line with our enterprise wide 'data language', that reflects the flow of the UBS group's critical data across applications
Support users across business divisions in navigating and using the contents of the group data dictionary to understand data sources and controls
Improve and further develop the processes and controls within the team, playing a key part in the migration to a new Data Dictionary IT solution by participating in IT requirements gathering, testing and releases
Produce metrics and reporting on the 'health' of the data dictionary, ensuring the resolution of all data integrity exceptions
Present back findings to executive management, both 1:1 and through existing governance forums, to confirm understanding and obtain ratification and
Maintain an excellent standard for all aspects of project delivery and governance, including planning, status reporting and risk management
Your team
You will be working in Group Operations within the Data Management Office (DMO). This role sits within the Data Lineage team, which operates out of Weehawken, London, Bangalore and Pune. The Data Lineage team is responsible for working directly with divisional subject matter experts, in both the business and IT, to map data flows in the organization and populate and maintain the group data dictionary. The DMO is responsible for embedding a data management culture into the organization by advocating for our strategy and proactively challenging the way the firm works with data. The DMO is made up of approximately 100 people, comprising UBS permanent staff, contractors and consultants.
Your expertise
At least 1-3 year(s) of experience in Financial Services, Consultancy or Data within other industries
Excellent analysis and documentation skills with the ability to grasp new concepts easily and to adapt within a changing environment
Methodical, concise and accurate, with strong attention to detail and excellent organisational skills, including the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, both written and oral; comfortable interacting with colleagues at all levels
Team player with a flexible and adaptable approach to work, and a motivated self-starter
Knowledge of Banking or Capital Markets and familiar with current regulations such as BCBS 239, IFRS, CCAR, and an understanding of application data governance and data management (desirable, not essential)
Your colleagues
About us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
Join us
We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: 11265 Market Data Integrations APAC Analyst
Description:
11265 Market Data Integrations APAC Analyst#132593
India-Pune-Pune
|
Full-time (FT)
|
Technology [IT]
|
Job ID
132593
Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.
We Offer
Market Data Integration (MDI) are responsible for deploying and supporting connectivity to electronic stock exchanges and external clients, as well as the numerous market data and service providers within the region, along with the Thomson Reuters Enterprise Platform which provides the bank with a consolidated platform for consuming Exchange Market Data.
MDI are expected to handle all relationships with technical account managers from the different vendors in order to maintain an ongoing roadmap in terms of upgrades and releases. The department is also responsible for handling the scripting, rollout and 2nd line support of various third party applications.
It is a dynamic environment aligned very closely with a number of Application Development teams located in different regions. Work is a combination of production support and project management, originating either from the vendors or from business teams within Credit Suisse.
You Offer
Install, maintain and document external infrastructure provided by CS or Vendor.
Assisting Engineering team to deliver strategic projects
Ensure that the external infrastructure is provisioned both in production and DR for smooth and efficient failover. Some of the major infrastructures we are responsible for include
Handle regional carrier’s relationship in order to maintain reduced levels of production outages and lead time for new projects.
You have handle relationship with internal partners (Low Latency Team, Network Team & the business.)
Provide regional issue for standalone vendor products.
Attend Incident management calls representing the regional
Script and support market data applications that have contracts negotiated by the Service Consultants.
Provide dedicated operational support level 3 for Market Data Environment
Perform operational duties using CS implementation of ITIL practices
Participate to regional projects within market data connectivity
Active participation to regional Book of work, which includes building positive relationship with clients/vendors
Administration of core market data platforms (Thomson Reuters TREP)
On-board products and services into Market Data environment
Be capable of technically administering the RMDS environment, scheduling and deploying changes to the platform and all major components (Within 30 Days of start)
Be fully familiar and aligned with problem management, Management Change and reporting systems
Role would be in Pune or Mumbai, but would have to cover APAC Market hours, with some travel required to Pune 1-2 times a month.
You have undergraduate Degree from University or College
You have minimum 5 years of IT experience, minimum 3 years in financial services.
You have knowledge of IP networks and components. TCP/IP, switches, routers, hubs etc., cabling issues, leased lines. Knowledge of enterprise networking and additional issues surrounding large scale network infrastructures.
Knowledge of network management software products & IT security (firewall management)
Deep dive network problem solving – e.g. packet bring together analysis, use of Wireshark decoders, experience using Niksun devices/products.
Multicast feed monitoring – experience designing solutions to monitor multicast UDP traffic for gaps and sequence mismatches – in particular in related to exchange feeds
You have deep understanding of latency measurement, packet bring together solutions
Familiarity with Market Data application and vendors, ie, Reuters, Bloomberg, etc. (a plus)
You have superb communication skills in client & vendor are important. You will spend a large part of his/her time working with external clients and vendors.
You have the ability to communicate effectively with team members at all levels as well as with Market Data vendors.
Ability to take ownership and be dedicated.
Ability to handle various tasks simultaneously and deep understanding of project management.
Ability to provide good written documentation.
You have experience supporting a global environment and user base (a plus).
Experienced in problem solving and technical troubleshooting.

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

Title: Sr Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
About this Opportunity
The Data Science & Analytics team designs and creates innovative solutions for a variety of applications, platforms and environments. Data Science & Analytics not only gives Target a competitive advantage in the marketplace, but also enhances the guest experience through the smart use of data in the retail industry
Our Senior Data Analyst researches data assets, applies various technologies to these assets and develops metrics, reports, and statistics. They are experts in sourcing data and providing the highest quality data for their business domain through the tools. Senior data analyst spend about 50% of their time advancing the development of metrics, reports and analysis into integrated dashboards. Through the deep understanding of their users and the data they consult on statistical analysis as well as contribute to measuring the key business outcomes as tests are applied. By translating that data into clear stories and insights data analysts help the business take action. They also play an active role with engineers and product owners ensuring the critical data is available and reliable in the proper platforms with clear SLAs. As a Sr Data Analyst, you'll take the lead in:
Actively exploring data and sourcing it from Teradata or Hadoop for specific analytical use cases. This includes researching data, perform joins on proper elements and create a final data asset to be consumed by analysts and users.
Joining and creating measurable insights from the data to be shared
Developing metrics, reports, and statistics
Documenting calculations, code, and adhering to data management principles
Validating and testing data assets of others in the form of peer review
Exploring statistical analysis using R or Python that could be applied to the data for providing insights
Performing descriptive statistics including mean, variance, median, correlation
Train and communicate output to users to gather feedback
Applies insights and testing in partnership with business users
Integrate tests and feedback on data assets to inform engineers on ways we can improve value of our data.
Perform analysis on business variables and identify tolerances/rates that are considered statistically significant.
Identifies data assets that can be integrated into dashboards and builds those based on user stories/personas
Requirements
BS degree or MS degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or area of study related to data sciences and data mining
Good working knowledge of SQL
Ability to work with technical and business-oriented teams
Worked on projects to build Big Data solutions using Hadoop and/or NoSQL technology
Ability to work with non-technical resources on the team to translate data needs into Big Data solutions using the appropriate tools
Understand application/software development and design in Agile methodology.
Collaborative personality, able to engage in interactive discussions with the rest of the team
Inquisitive on Big Data technology; current on new ideas and analytical tools like R, Python, Scala
Good understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem and low level constructs
Understanding of statistics
Benefits
Eligible team members will receive market competitive package including competitive pay, health, accidental and life insurance coverage, gratuity and provident fund, training and development and other perks and benefits. Target is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and is a drug-free workplace.
About Target®
Expect the Best. At Target, we have a vision: to become the best - the best culture and brand, the best place for growth and the company with the best reputation. We offer an inclusive, collaborative and energetic work environment that rewards those who perform. We deliver engaging, innovative and on-trend experiences for our team members and our guests. Minneapolis-based Target Corporation serves guests at stores nationwide and at Target.com. Qualifications:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
About us:
Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.
Behind one of the world’s best loved brands is a uniquely capable and brilliant team of data scientists, engineers and analysts. The Target Data Science & Analytics team creates the tools and data products to sustainably educate and enable our business partners to make great data-based decisions. We help develop the technology that personalizes the guest experience, from product recommendations to relevant ad content. We’re also the source of the data and analytics behind Target’s Internet of Things (IOT) applications, fraud detection, Supply Chain optimization and demand forecasting. We play a key role in identifying the test-and-measure or A/B test opportunities that continuously help Target improve the guest experience, whether they love to shop in stores or at Target.com.
A role with Data Science and Analytics (DSA) means being a part of the team that works closely with the business and identifies problems / opportunities for improved decision-making through better data analysis. This covers the whole gamut from simple descriptive analysis to more complex predictive and prescriptive analytics, using advanced modeling and machine learning techniques primarily using open source technologies and big data platforms. The emphasis is on actionable insights, which is possible through a combination of technical skills and business understanding.
As Data Analyst, DSA you will work closely with business/product teams and understand their priorities/roadmap. Based on this understanding, you are expected to identify appropriate metrics that will drive the right decisions for the business, and then build reporting solutions to deliver these metrics at the required frequency in an optimal and reliable fashion. You will also answer ad-hoc questions from your business users by conducting quick analysis on relevant data, identify trends and correlations, and form hypotheses to explain the observations. Some of these will lead to bigger analytical projects of increasing complexity, where you will work initially as a part of a bigger team, but also work independently as you gain more experience. Finally, you are expected to always adhere to project schedule and technical rigor as well as requirements for documentation, code versioning, etc.
Core responsibilities are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.
About You:
B.Tech / B.E. or equivalent experience
1+ years of relevant experience
“Hands-on” experience in analytics / data science
Understanding of foundational mathematics and statistics
Conceptual understanding of analytical techniques like Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Time-series models, Classification Techniques, etc.
Basic SQL skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills to explain complex analytical methodologies to clients regardless of the clients technical expertise
Exposure to R, Python, Hive, or other open source languages preferable
Big data experience preferable

Qualifications:

Title: Sr Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
About this Opportunity
The Data Science & Analytics team designs and creates innovative solutions for a variety of applications, platforms and environments. Data Science & Analytics not only gives Target a competitive advantage in the marketplace, but also enhances the guest experience through the smart use of data in the retail industry
Our Senior Data Analyst researches data assets, applies various technologies to these assets and develops metrics, reports, and statistics. They are experts in sourcing data and providing the highest quality data for their business domain through the tools. Senior data analyst spend about 50% of their time advancing the development of metrics, reports and analysis into integrated dashboards. Through the deep understanding of their users and the data they consult on statistical analysis as well as contribute to measuring the key business outcomes as tests are applied. By translating that data into clear stories and insights data analysts help the business take action. They also play an active role with engineers and product owners ensuring the critical data is available and reliable in the proper platforms with clear SLAs. As a Sr Data Analyst, you'll take the lead in:
Actively exploring data and sourcing it from Teradata or Hadoop for specific analytical use cases. This includes researching data, perform joins on proper elements and create a final data asset to be consumed by analysts and users.
Joining and creating measurable insights from the data to be shared
Developing metrics, reports, and statistics
Documenting calculations, code, and adhering to data management principles
Validating and testing data assets of others in the form of peer review
Exploring statistical analysis using R or Python that could be applied to the data for providing insights
Performing descriptive statistics including mean, variance, median, correlation
Train and communicate output to users to gather feedback
Applies insights and testing in partnership with business users
Integrate tests and feedback on data assets to inform engineers on ways we can improve value of our data.
Perform analysis on business variables and identify tolerances/rates that are considered statistically significant.
Identifies data assets that can be integrated into dashboards and builds those based on user stories/personas
Requirements
BS degree or MS degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or area of study related to data sciences and data mining
Good working knowledge of SQL
Ability to work with technical and business-oriented teams
Worked on projects to build Big Data solutions using Hadoop and/or NoSQL technology
Ability to work with non-technical resources on the team to translate data needs into Big Data solutions using the appropriate tools
Understand application/software development and design in Agile methodology.
Collaborative personality, able to engage in interactive discussions with the rest of the team
Inquisitive on Big Data technology; current on new ideas and analytical tools like R, Python, Scala
Good understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem and low level constructs
Understanding of statistics
Benefits
Eligible team members will receive market competitive package including competitive pay, health, accidental and life insurance coverage, gratuity and provident fund, training and development and other perks and benefits. Target is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and is a drug-free workplace.

Title: Analyst Quality Programs
Description:
Description:
PRIMARY FUNCTION
Ensures a high level of quality service for guests and business partners by owning the assigned quality processes and projects related to Quality Support applications. Create and maintain new capabilities, assist TI quality team and other partners in obtaining data relevant to applicable strategies, and work to ensure stable, reliable, consistent tools and data sources.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for the planning & execution of projects/workload by building, tuning, maintaining all interaction analytics categories within applicable tools.
Handle reporting, calibrations, data collection & other interactions with Target India & MPLS partners.
Own & Lead efforts to analyze data and provide recommendations to support TI Managers and Quality Support Specialists by listening to calls, analyzing transactions & other non-call data. By compiling information and reporting from quality tools, support the execution of targeted quality projects, contact center agent performance, contact center guest experience (Net promoter score), compliance discrepancies etc.…
Act as a subject matter expert for the related work stream, lead projects and other initiatives assigned as a POC, adhering to all POC responsibilities. Support other work streams as required.
Collaborates effectively within the Quality team (TI & MPLS) to clearly define objectives, requirements, timelines, analysis requirement and success measures of projects/initiatives of related work-stream.
Measure performance (Accuracy, Timelines, POC responsibilities etc.) through tracking feedback from auditors and partners as a POC on all assigned projects and call out challenges on a timely manner to ensure smooth experience for Partners and Auditors.
Train & share knowledge as required – create training plans, training documents, share feedback on trainee progress & manage their performance through the ramp period.
Interact with TI POC’s, QSS and TI Managers to identify, define and measure the impact of work/data capture completed by the auditors.
Maintain track record of performance, impact and feedback received for POC’s/responsible Level3’s on all projects/initiatives and call out trends to TI Managers.
Own, publish and present end to end of critical reviews & reports, dashboards of processes as applicable to the relevant stakeholders. Create & maintain documentation on the processes supported to iron out any discrepancies & have clear guidelines for future support.
Perform additional responsibilities as assigned
Work towards the Team deliverables in Target India. Contribute to the overall productivity and accuracy as per standards defined in the team
Drive the different initiatives in Target India with enthusiasm and in a fast, fun and friendly way.
Support project and department leaders to identify, analyze and evaluate business/Team issues.
Make recommendations for process improvement and participates in implementation of new initiatives.
Flexibility to work outside normal business hours as required
REPORTING/WORKING RELATIONSHIPS
Reports to: TI Sr. Manager
Working relationships with Quality Business Consultants and FRS business areas as need, including Business Systems, Global Operations, and contact center leader

3 years of relevant experience in contact center (listening to calls, managing reports etc.)
3 years Bachelor’s Degree
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Strong problem solving, critical thinking and decision making skills,
Data Mining, Ability to identify data trends
Strong Team player
Root cause Analysis and concepts of yellow belt, Lean
Project management skills & Presentation skills
Reporting and analytical skills
High MS office & VBA knowledge on Excel
DESIRED REQUIREMENTS
Speech analytics capabilities

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Data Management practice is set up under Business Intelligence/BI Function with scope covering various Maersk group companies. This organization is responsible for Data Management & Data Governance of all Data in Maersk group including Master data, Reference data and even Transactional data. We also support internal projects with offerings like Data Governance set up, Access Management, Data Quality Review, Data Profiling, Data Reporting, Data Migration & Data Mapping.
We offer
As an employee with Maersk GSC you will be part of a working environment as diverse as the APMM group. Maersk strongly encourages continuous learning at work and sharing of best practices by rewarding innovations. We aren’t all about work, we believe in a holistic development of our employees and so regularly organize recreational activities giving our employees a chance to unwind and showcase their creative side. As an organization we strongly believe in a people-centric approach with emphasis on employee engagement and work-life balance.
Key responsibilities
The Data Quality Analyst will be responsible for the following tasks, amongst others:

Staging data into DQ repository form multiple source systems for data quality analysis.

Examining the data and collecting statistics or informative summaries about that data.

Running data profiling on the source data and identifying and reporting anomalies based on pre-defined business rules / standards

Assess data quality, including whether the data conforms to standards or patterns.

Assess the risk involved in integrating data in new applications, including the challenges of joins

Raising data quality level for different data objects.

Providing a high level of data quality awareness among users to get the clean-up done.

Helps the Scrum Master & Product Owner in the ongoing management of the backlog, working ahead of the team to ensure that future product requirements are well defined

Evaluating and identifying where system enhancements are required.

Sharing data quality reports with business users at regular intervals.

Coordinate with business users for performing manual cleansing as required

Supports Business Data Stewards to develop and refine Business Metadata.

Lookout for changes to data-related legislation for external business implications as well as internal communications and compliance

We are looking for
Should have high energy level, and thrive in a fast-paced environment with ambitions to deliver outstanding results. We require fluency in oral and written English, and proven experience with the
following:

5-6 years of experience working as a Data Analyst in a global organisation with understanding of SQL query writing and exposure to Informatica ETL tool.

Good understanding of data quality life cycle and data quality dimensions.

Excellent Data Profiling and Data Quality skills.

Collaboration and teamwork, and an ability to look beyond functional needs to the bigger picture

Grasping complex issues and driving effective problem solving

Proven passion for the data quality discipline

Good interpersonal skills

Outstanding attention to detail

Talent for quickly learning new tasks

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

A strong drive for results

Ability to function in a high-volume setting with tight deadlines

Demonstrates ability to think both strategically and tactically.

Experience with the principles and concepts used in Master Data Management.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
MoneyGram International now requires a Business Analyst in Mumbai to be the liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies, and possibly information systems. As the Business Analyst you understand and analyze business processes and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. The Business Analyst must clearly understand project change management and how the role plays a key piece in the change management process. You must also be able to fulfill basic project management responsibilities throughout the project lifecycle.
Primary Responsibilities

Independently initiates, identifies and coordinates the analysis of business needs in project areas.
Interfaces or liaison between business owners/users and development project teams to determine, communicate and validate business requirements.
Supports projects by understanding business needs, opportunities, problems, impacts, risks, and presents and agrees to recommended solutions.
Understands, gathers, and defines requirements of all types, and documents with process flows and diagrams.
Writes detailed business requirements, functional specifications and, when involved in project teams using an iterative development methodology.
Identifies and communicates requirement/scope issues.
Ties the strategic objectives to the project and quickly demonstrates a detailed understanding of the business, and be able to help determine solutions to problems.
Identifies opportunities for increasing business efficiency through improved manual and automated process systems.
Understands business processes and products for assigned business functions and the relationships between those processes and information systems, including the impact of system changes to business processes.
Determines the impact of system change to the business and vice versa.
Builds consensus among stakeholders, often recapping direction and decisions made.
Applies logic to conflict management and issues.
Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
Supports a variety of applications, sites, and departments.
Assists in facilitating User Acceptance Testing or derive test strategy in creating and reviewing test cases.
Communicates risks and ensures understanding of these risks.
Provides on-going project management and status reporting at all levels.
Creates and maintains project schedules by developing project plans and functional specifications, estimating time requirements, establishing deadlines, monitoring milestone completion, and tracking all phases of the project lifecycle.
Provides timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions, and resolving conflicts.
Conducts project meetings with project team(s) regularly to review project deliverables and deadlines.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Title: Sr Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
About this Opportunity
The Data Science & Analytics team designs and creates innovative solutions for a variety of applications, platforms and environments. Data Science & Analytics not only gives Target a competitive advantage in the marketplace, but also enhances the guest experience through the smart use of data in the retail industry
Our senior data analyst researches data assets, applies various technologies to these assets and develops metrics, reports, and statistics. They are experts in sourcing data and providing the highest quality data for their business domain through the tools. Senior data analyst spend about 50% of their time advancing the development of metrics, reports and analysis into integrated dashboards. Through the deep understanding of their users and the data they consult on statistical analysis as well as contribute to measuring the key business outcomes as tests are applied. By translating that data into clear stories and insights data analysts help the business take action. They also play an active role with engineers and product owners ensuring the critical data is available and reliable in the proper platforms with clear SLAs. As a Sr Data Analyst, you'll take the lead in:
Actively exploring data and sourcing it from Teradata or Hadoop for specific analytical use cases. This includes researching data, perform joins on proper elements and create a final data asset to be consumed by analysts and users.
Joining and creating measurable insights from the data to be shared
Developing metrics, reports, and statistics
Documenting calculations, code, and adhering to data management principles
Validating and testing data assets of others in the form of peer review
Exploring statistical analysis using R or Python that could be applied to the data for providing insights
Performing descriptive statistics including mean, variance, median, correlation
Train and communicate output to users to gather feedback
Applies insights and testing in partnership with business users
Integrate tests and feedback on data assets to inform engineers on ways we can improve value of our data.
Perform analysis on business variables and identify tolerances/rates that are considered statistically significant.
Identifies data assets that can be integrated into dashboards and builds those based on user stories/personas
Requirements
BS degree or MS degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or area of study related to data sciences and data mining
Good working knowledge of SQL
Ability to work with technical and business-oriented teams
Worked on projects to build Big Data solutions using Hadoop and/or NoSQL technology
Ability to work with non-technical resources on the team to translate data needs into Big Data solutions using the appropriate tools
Understand application/software development and design in Agile methodology.
Collaborative personality, able to engage in interactive discussions with the rest of the team
Inquisitive on Big Data technology; current on new ideas and analytical tools like R, Python, Scala
Good understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem and low level constructs
Understanding of statistics
Benefits
Eligible team members will receive market competitive package including competitive pay, health, accidental and life insurance coverage, gratuity and provident fund, training and development and other perks and benefits. Target is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and is a drug-free workplace.
About Target®
Expect the Best. At Target, we have a vision: to become the best - the best culture and brand, the best place for growth and the company with the best reputation. We offer an inclusive, collaborative and energetic work environment that rewards those who perform. We deliver engaging, innovative and on-trend experiences for our team members and our guests. We invest in our team members' futures by developing leaders and providing a breadth of opportunities for professional development. It takes the best to become the best, and we are committed to building a team that does the right thing for our guests, shareholders, team members and communities.
Minneapolis-based Target Corporation serves guests at stores nationwide and at Target.com. Target is committed to providing a fun and convenient shopping experience with access to unique and highly differentiated products at affordable prices. Since 1946, the corporation has given 5 percent of its income through community grants and programs like Take Charge of Education®.

Title: Stock / Equity Analyst
Description:
* Enthusiastic BCom, BSc or BA graduates with or without experience
* Must have real passion for US stock markets and derivatives trading
* Help develop/enhance existing processes and systems for better predictions and portfolio building
* Must have good knowledge in Computers (excel & word), and keen interest in data analysis
* Only serious candidates with real passion on Finance and/or technology need to apply. Please avoid if you are not seriously committed-to-the-work type of candidate.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
SUMMARY OF WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO
**
Who are we?
We are Banking professionals passionate about stocks and its derivatives
What are we doing here?
We are setting up an operation to Trade Stocks, Options, Commodities and other financial products
What have we done since last year?
We built an initial version of Machine learning based system that uses different inputs to predict the future direction of stock prices. We keep on improving this by getting inputs from our analysts who give us directions to include/exclude the factors that have/havent any influence on the stocks
What is the work for people in Coimbatore?
Two analysts will do a massive deep research into identifying the factors that affect the price of the stocks and also suggest us to buy or sell stocks that have high probability of success. Its a challenging work. You can imagine the analogy of how weather forecasting works and how the technology has improved the accuracy of that over the years. Analysts will do the analysis and recommendation work while the developer doing the coding work to implement the recommendations.
How is day to day life look like?
Its gut-wrenching business. You would feel so high one day when your suggestions and predictions turn out to be true and the following day can make you look very ordinary when your ideas do not work out the way you expected. We know that we will lose and win almost equally during initial stages but with knowledge and experience, we will definitely improve this ratio. This is what we want all employees to feel about and challenge themselves to improve.
What should an ideal candidate have for this position?
Total commitment and always trying to challenge her/his own and others’ ideas to make the overall system/process produce a better result. We value the integrity most and we don’t compromise on that.
Is it suitable for you if you know nothing about Finance/stocks?
It depends! If you have an attitude to learn, you would find it easy to learn. Just google/youtube to learn basics - you are ready to deep-dive into the complex world of finance.
What's the financial reward for employees?
We use your ideas to buy or sell stocks and make money. We even share the profits to the employees, payable if profited every 6 months.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹12,000.00 to ₹15,000.00 /month
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Location:
Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu (Preferred)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
About us:
Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.
Behind one of the world’s best loved brands is a uniquely capable and brilliant team of data scientists, engineers and analysts. The Target Data Science & Analytics team creates the tools and data products to sustainably educate and enable our business partners to make great data-based decisions. We help develop the technology that personalizes the guest experience, from product recommendations to relevant ad content. We’re also the source of the data and analytics behind Target’s Internet of Things (IOT) applications, fraud detection, Supply Chain optimization and demand forecasting. We play a key role in identifying the test-and-measure or A/B test opportunities that continuously help Target improve the guest experience, whether they love to shop in stores or at Target.com.
A role with Data Science and Analytics (DSA) means being a part of the team that works closely with the business and identifies problems / opportunities for improved decision-making through better data analysis. This covers the whole gamut from simple descriptive analysis to more complex predictive and prescriptive analytics, using advanced modeling and machine learning techniques primarily using open source technologies and big data platforms. The emphasis is on actionable insights, which is possible through a combination of technical skills and business understanding.
As Data Analyst, DSA you will work closely with business/product teams and understand their priorities/roadmap. Based on this understanding, you are expected to identify appropriate metrics that will drive the right decisions for the business, and then build reporting solutions to deliver these metrics at the required frequency in an optimal and reliable fashion. You will also answer ad-hoc questions from your business users by conducting quick analysis on relevant data, identify trends and correlations, and form hypotheses to explain the observations. Some of these will lead to bigger analytical projects of increasing complexity, where you will work initially as a part of a bigger team, but also work independently as you gain more experience. Finally, you are expected to always adhere to project schedule and technical rigor as well as requirements for documentation, code versioning, etc.
Core responsibilities are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.
About You:
B.Tech / B.E. or equivalent experience
1+ years of relevant experience
“Hands-on” experience in analytics / data science
Understanding of foundational mathematics and statistics
Conceptual understanding of analytical techniques like Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Time-series models, Classification Techniques, etc.
Basic SQL skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills to explain complex analytical methodologies to clients regardless of the clients technical expertise
Exposure to R, Python, Hive, or other open source languages preferable
Big data experience preferable

Title: Junior Research Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION: RESEARCH ANALYST
OVERVIEW
When companies need to understand their clients and prospects, benchmark their
competitive environment or better manage their internal talent, they turn to Coalition*.
Coalition (www.coalition.com) is a leading business intelligence provider. Formed in 2002, we
are a young, dynamic high growth company firmly established as a premium brand in the
financial services markets.
We deliver deep analytical research on market peers, revenue opportunities, overall market
size and conditions and the human capital and technology assets that enable and inform the
strategy of high-margin, fast-moving, opaque businesses.
In your role you will provide a unique offering of intelligence driven solutions, underpinned by
bespoke technology, that maps marketplaces, including companies, professionals, products,
and the relationships between them which allow financial institutions to make key strategic
decisions ahead of their competitors.
As an employer, Coalition is able to offer you the following: 
Opportunities for personal career growth and development 
Investment in training allied with extensive on-the-job learning 
A chance to work alongside like-minded, intelligent, highly-motivated individuals 
An entrepreneurial, creative, fun and challenging workplace 
A close team environment
In June 2012, Coalition, reached an agreement to be acquired by CRISIL, a subsidiary of
Standard & Poor's and a leading provider of ratings, research and risk and policy advisory
services.
About CRISIL Limited, a Standard & Poor's Company (www.crisil.com)
CRISIL is a global analytical company providing ratings, research, and risk and policy advisory services. We are
India’s leading ratings agency. We are also the foremost provider of high-end research to the world’s largest
banks and leading corporations. Our majority shareholder is Standard & Poor's(S&P). Standard & Poor's, a part of
The McGraw-Hill Companies (NYSE:MHP), is the world's foremost provider of credit ratings.
OPPORTUNITY
This opportunity is based in Airoli, Navi Mumbai. The successful individual in this position will
be able to make an effective contribution given the opportunities for personal career growth
and development without the bureaucracy and constraints that may exist in a large
organisation.
Domain: Financial Services
Location: Airoli, Navi Mumbai
Experience: 0 – 2 years
Employment Type: Full time
JOB PROFILE
The job involves conducting business research to support clients and contributing to internal
knowledge building efforts. It involves understanding and structuring data related to the
human capital and business aspects within the financial services / transaction banking/
investment banking domain.
Key responsibilities involve; 
Interpret, analyze and structure data on a bespoke database 
Data mine and scan financial industry information and collect data available on public
domain through e-news papers, journals etc on assigned investment bank/ product
area. 
Undertake research relevant to the assigned client/s through annual reports, industry
reports, white papers etc. 
Create research deliverables – market/ industry summaries, weekly reports &
presentations 
Develop research protocol and analytical frameworks
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
The successful candidate will have to demonstrate the following skills, experience and
attributes: 
Excellent academic background. CFA-1 cleared from U.S preferred. 
Good data comprehension and analytical skills 
Knowledge of capital markets/ transaction banking preferred 
Excellent written and communications skills 
A strong degree of independence and self-motivation 
Fluency in spoken English is essential 
Excellent working skills with MS office tools, especially good at advanced Excel and
PowerPoint 
Working knowledge of professional information services like Bloomberg, Thomson
Reuters etc preferred

Company Description
The aim of the Shell Business Operations, Chennai is to provide the Group with operational excellence through highlighting and utilizing process improvements and functional efficiencies as well as by leveraging economies of scale. Currently, the Chennai centre provides a wide range of finance, accounting and business services to Shell operating companies across several business sectors globally.
Set up in September 2007, the Chennai centre has grown rapidly and now , in its fourth year of operations , it has crossed the 1600 staff mark. The centre is located in the RMZ Millennia Business Park, where the Shell campus is a LEED Platinum building with world class infrastructure. The business is expected to grow further over the next two years and infrastructural additions to support this have been planned.
The main focus in Chennai is on Finance Operations which supports delivery of the global Finance functional plan. There is also a ‘Downstream India’ - Customer Services Team that handles lubricant depot ordering within the country. The Shell Business Operations (SBO Team) manages the centre facilities and supports business partners’ operations on site. There is a strong focus at SBO on safety & well being of staff and on its three core values: Compliance, Intervention & Respect.

Title: Sr Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
About this Opportunity
The Data Science & Analytics team designs and creates innovative solutions for a variety of applications, platforms and environments. Data Science & Analytics not only gives Target a competitive advantage in the marketplace, but also enhances the guest experience through the smart use of data in the retail industry
Our senior data analyst researches data assets, applies various technologies to these assets and develops metrics, reports, and statistics. They are experts in sourcing data and providing the highest quality data for their business domain through the tools. Senior data analyst spend about 50% of their time advancing the development of metrics, reports and analysis into integrated dashboards. Through the deep understanding of their users and the data they consult on statistical analysis as well as contribute to measuring the key business outcomes as tests are applied. By translating that data into clear stories and insights data analysts help the business take action. They also play an active role with engineers and product owners ensuring the critical data is available and reliable in the proper platforms with clear SLAs. As a Sr Data Analyst, you'll take the lead in:
Actively exploring data and sourcing it from Teradata or Hadoop for specific analytical use cases. This includes researching data, perform joins on proper elements and create a final data asset to be consumed by analysts and users.
Joining and creating measurable insights from the data to be shared
Developing metrics, reports, and statistics
Documenting calculations, code, and adhering to data management principles
Validating and testing data assets of others in the form of peer review
Exploring statistical analysis using R or Python that could be applied to the data for providing insights
Performing descriptive statistics including mean, variance, median, correlation
Train and communicate output to users to gather feedback
Applies insights and testing in partnership with business users
Integrate tests and feedback on data assets to inform engineers on ways we can improve value of our data.
Perform analysis on business variables and identify tolerances/rates that are considered statistically significant.
Identifies data assets that can be integrated into dashboards and builds those based on user stories/personas
Requirements
BS degree or MS degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or area of study related to data sciences and data mining
Good working knowledge of SQL
Ability to work with technical and business-oriented teams
Worked on projects to build Big Data solutions using Hadoop and/or NoSQL technology
Ability to work with non-technical resources on the team to translate data needs into Big Data solutions using the appropriate tools
Understand application/software development and design in Agile methodology.
Collaborative personality, able to engage in interactive discussions with the rest of the team
Inquisitive on Big Data technology; current on new ideas and analytical tools like R, Python, Scala
Good understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem and low level constructs
Understanding of statistics
Benefits
Eligible team members will receive market competitive package including competitive pay, health, accidental and life insurance coverage, gratuity and provident fund, training and development and other perks and benefits. Target is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and is a drug-free workplace.
About Target®
Expect the Best. At Target, we have a vision: to become the best - the best culture and brand, the best place for growth and the company with the best reputation. We offer an inclusive, collaborative and energetic work environment that rewards those who perform. We deliver engaging, innovative and on-trend experiences for our team members and our guests. We invest in our team members' futures by developing leaders and providing a breadth of opportunities for professional development. It takes the best to become the best, and we are committed to building a team that does the right thing for our guests, shareholders, team members and communities.
Minneapolis-based Target Corporation serves guests at stores nationwide and at Target.com. Target is committed to providing a fun and convenient shopping experience with access to unique and highly differentiated products at affordable prices. Since 1946, the corporation has given 5 percent of its income through community grants and programs like Take Charge of Education®.

Qualifications:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
About us:
Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.
Behind one of the world’s best loved brands is a uniquely capable and brilliant team of data scientists, engineers and analysts. The Target Data Science & Analytics team creates the tools and data products to sustainably educate and enable our business partners to make great data-based decisions. We help develop the technology that personalizes the guest experience, from product recommendations to relevant ad content. We’re also the source of the data and analytics behind Target’s Internet of Things (IOT) applications, fraud detection, Supply Chain optimization and demand forecasting. We play a key role in identifying the test-and-measure or A/B test opportunities that continuously help Target improve the guest experience, whether they love to shop in stores or at Target.com.
A role with Data Science and Analytics (DSA) means being a part of the team that works closely with the business and identifies problems / opportunities for improved decision-making through better data analysis. This covers the whole gamut from simple descriptive analysis to more complex predictive and prescriptive analytics, using advanced modeling and machine learning techniques primarily using open source technologies and big data platforms. The emphasis is on actionable insights, which is possible through a combination of technical skills and business understanding.
As Data Analyst, DSA you will work closely with business/product teams and understand their priorities/roadmap. Based on this understanding, you are expected to identify appropriate metrics that will drive the right decisions for the business, and then build reporting solutions to deliver these metrics at the required frequency in an optimal and reliable fashion. You will also answer ad-hoc questions from your business users by conducting quick analysis on relevant data, identify trends and correlations, and form hypotheses to explain the observations. Some of these will lead to bigger analytical projects of increasing complexity, where you will work initially as a part of a bigger team, but also work independently as you gain more experience. Finally, you are expected to always adhere to project schedule and technical rigor as well as requirements for documentation, code versioning, etc.
Core responsibilities are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.
About You:
B.Tech / B.E. or equivalent experience
1+ years of relevant experience
“Hands-on” experience in analytics / data science
Understanding of foundational mathematics and statistics
Conceptual understanding of analytical techniques like Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Time-series models, Classification Techniques, etc.
Basic SQL skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills to explain complex analytical methodologies to clients regardless of the clients technical expertise
Exposure to R, Python, Hive, or other open source languages preferable
Big data experience preferable

Title: Vendor Master Data Analyst

Title: Analyst Quality Programs
Description:
Description:
PRIMARY FUNCTION
Ensures a high level of quality service for guests and business partners by owning the assigned quality processes and projects related to Quality Support applications. Create and maintain new capabilities, assist TI quality team and other partners in obtaining data relevant to applicable strategies, and work to ensure stable, reliable, consistent tools and data sources.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for the planning & execution of projects/workload by building, tuning, maintaining all interaction analytics categories within applicable tools.
Handle reporting, calibrations, data collection & other interactions with Target India & MPLS partners.
Own & Lead efforts to analyze data and provide recommendations to support TI Managers and Quality Support Specialists by listening to calls, analyzing transactions & other non-call data. By compiling information and reporting from quality tools, support the execution of targeted quality projects, contact center agent performance, contact center guest experience (Net promoter score), compliance discrepancies etc.…
Act as a subject matter expert for the related work stream, lead projects and other initiatives assigned as a POC, adhering to all POC responsibilities. Support other work streams as required.
Collaborates effectively within the Quality team (TI & MPLS) to clearly define objectives, requirements, timelines, analysis requirement and success measures of projects/initiatives of related work-stream.
Measure performance (Accuracy, Timelines, POC responsibilities etc.) through tracking feedback from auditors and partners as a POC on all assigned projects and call out challenges on a timely manner to ensure smooth experience for Partners and Auditors.
Train & share knowledge as required – create training plans, training documents, share feedback on trainee progress & manage their performance through the ramp period.
Interact with TI POC’s, QSS and TI Managers to identify, define and measure the impact of work/data capture completed by the auditors.
Maintain track record of performance, impact and feedback received for POC’s/responsible Level3’s on all projects/initiatives and call out trends to TI Managers.
Own, publish and present end to end of critical reviews & reports, dashboards of processes as applicable to the relevant stakeholders. Create & maintain documentation on the processes supported to iron out any discrepancies & have clear guidelines for future support.
Perform additional responsibilities as assigned
Work towards the Team deliverables in Target India. Contribute to the overall productivity and accuracy as per standards defined in the team
Drive the different initiatives in Target India with enthusiasm and in a fast, fun and friendly way.
Support project and department leaders to identify, analyze and evaluate business/Team issues.
Make recommendations for process improvement and participates in implementation of new initiatives.
Flexibility to work outside normal business hours as required
REPORTING/WORKING RELATIONSHIPS
Reports to: TI Sr. Manager
Working relationships with Quality Business Consultants and FRS business areas as need, including Business Systems, Global Operations, and contact center leader
JOB REQUIREMENTS
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
3 years of relevant experience in contact center (listening to calls, managing reports etc.)
3 years Bachelor’s Degree
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Strong problem solving, critical thinking and decision making skills,
Data Mining, Ability to identify data trends
Strong Team player
Root cause Analysis and concepts of yellow belt, Lean
Project management skills & Presentation skills
Reporting and analytical skills
High MS office & VBA knowledge on Excel
DESIRED REQUIREMENTS
Speech analytics capabilities

Qualifications:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
About us:
Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.
Behind one of the world’s best loved brands is a uniquely capable and brilliant team of data scientists, engineers and analysts. The Target Data Science & Analytics team creates the tools and data products to sustainably educate and enable our business partners to make great data-based decisions. We help develop the technology that personalizes the guest experience, from product recommendations to relevant ad content. We’re also the source of the data and analytics behind Target’s Internet of Things (IOT) applications, fraud detection, Supply Chain optimization and demand forecasting. We play a key role in identifying the test-and-measure or A/B test opportunities that continuously help Target improve the guest experience, whether they love to shop in stores or at Target.com.
A role with Data Science and Analytics (DSA) means being a part of the team that works closely with the business and identifies problems / opportunities for improved decision-making through better data analysis. This covers the whole gamut from simple descriptive analysis to more complex predictive and prescriptive analytics, using advanced modeling and machine learning techniques primarily using open source technologies and big data platforms. The emphasis is on actionable insights, which is possible through a combination of technical skills and business understanding.
As Data Analyst, DSA you will work closely with business/product teams and understand their priorities/roadmap. Based on this understanding, you are expected to identify appropriate metrics that will drive the right decisions for the business, and then build reporting solutions to deliver these metrics at the required frequency in an optimal and reliable fashion. You will also answer ad-hoc questions from your business users by conducting quick analysis on relevant data, identify trends and correlations, and form hypotheses to explain the observations. Some of these will lead to bigger analytical projects of increasing complexity, where you will work initially as a part of a bigger team, but also work independently as you gain more experience. Finally, you are expected to always adhere to project schedule and technical rigor as well as requirements for documentation, code versioning, etc.
Core responsibilities are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.
About You:
B.Tech / B.E. or equivalent experience
1+ years of relevant experience
“Hands-on” experience in analytics / data science
Understanding of foundational mathematics and statistics
Conceptual understanding of analytical techniques like Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Time-series models, Classification Techniques, etc.
Basic SQL skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills to explain complex analytical methodologies to clients regardless of the clients technical expertise
Exposure to R, Python, Hive, or other open source languages preferable
Big data experience preferable

Title: Sr Financial Analyst
Description:
What's the role?
This role is part of the global Finance and Control team. This team consists of subject matter experts in corporate finance, business finance, accounting and taxation. These professionals partner with HERE’s stakeholders with fact–driven insights that drive business performance. Crafting financial strategy, creating a foundation of business information and advising business on all matters finance forms the basis of day to day work.

As Sr Financial Analyst, you will become part of the global Finance and Control team and be based in Mumbai. You will be a key member of a newly established center of excellence overseeing deal-based information, providing timely validation, reporting and analysis to support the growth of the organization - both regionally and globally. This includes analysis of deal terms, validation of assumptions, analysis of historic information, trends and future projections, performance monitoring, providing internal and external reporting. In this role you will identify risks and opportunities and ensure consistent best-in-class quality of information and operational support.

You will partner with a fast paced and high performing finance team, to ensure we meet our short-term and long-term objectives. You will also interact on an ongoing basis with Sales, Legal, Accounting and other cross-functional departments located across the globe.
These are the key responsibilities and tasks that will help you succeed in this role:
Serve as a key member of the newly established center of excellence, be an important partner for the Customer organization, as well as key operational stakeholders to provide financial transparency and decision support
Serve as the liaison with respect to financial matters between Finance & Control, Sales, Accounting, Legal, Pricing & other teams
Develop a robust understanding of HERE, its products, its markets and its internal organization to form an objective perspective, detect trends and provide insightful analysis and communicate this effectively to senior management
Conduct the deal-level analysis and input across financial and other systems. Provide reports on current vs planned performance, including implications for targeting, forecasting and compensation across our Customer organization
Develop analyses, simulation models, new tools, reports and templates to support planning and decision making, drive efficiencies and enable the company’s ambitious growth plans
Provide specialist advice/input in complex and broad financial issues, e.g. bookings system, partner revenue, product P&L, operational expenses, deferred revenue, etc.
Who are you?
You will be the ideal candidate for this role if:
You have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant area (economics, finance, business administration or other)
You have 5+ years of relevant international experience
You have a strong analytical mindset with the capacity to draw out conclusions from large, complex data sets and bridge information across systems and formats
You have an excellent attention to the details
You are proficient in modeling skills including advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
Preferably you have knowledge and experience with enterprise reporting and planning systems (Hyperion Planning, Workspace, Smart View, Peoplesoft and other)
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills with a customer focused, professional demeanor
You can work with business partners in a fast-paced business environment, deliver measurable results and build trust with leaders
Good communication skills along with expereince working with global teams
Who are we?
Ever checked in somewhere on social media? Ever tracked your online orders? You might be using HERE Technologies every single day without even realizing it. You can find us everywhere: in vehicles, smartphones, drones or third-party apps. We believe that with the right people, we will continue to be a game-changer in the technology industry and improve the daily lives of people around the world.
